articles.content:
Repeal of S. Korea-U.S. Mutual Defense Treaty Demanded 
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration reportedly published a statement on October 1 with regard to the lapse of 51 years after the signing of the shameful south Korea-U.S. "mutual defense treaty". In the statement it called for an early repeal of the treaty and an end to the military occupation by the U.S. forces.
 The treaty aimed to keep the U.S. forces in south Korea permanently is little short of a slave pact which legally backs the U.S. intervention and domination, said the statement.    
 It charged that the U.S. had legalized the occupation of south Korea by its forces and massively introduced ultra modern lethal weapons and military hardware there on the strength of the treaty for more than a half century, rendering the situation of the Korean peninsula constantly strained.

Chinese Embassy Officials Work with Koreans
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Work with Koreans 
    Pyongyang, October 5 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Wu Donghe and officials of the Chinese embassy here Monday worked with Korean workers at the construction site of the Taean Friendship Glass Factory in Taean County, South Phyongan Province, deepening friendship with them.
 After being briefed about the progress of the construction of the factory, they joined in building the protection walls of the melting shop, encouraging Korean builders who were effecting innovations every day out of the desire to erect the factory as a monumental edifice of the times.    
 Expressing his admiration at the fast progressing construction of the factory, a symbol of Sino-Korean friendship, after its ground-breaking, the ambassador hoped that the Korean builders would splendidly erect the factory which is taking shape under the deep concern of the leaders of the two countries.
